Keywords: Cosmic , Deity , Herald
Real Name: Uatu
Special Powers
PONDER THE QUESTION...WHAT IF?: At the beginning of the game, roll a d6 and give The Watcher a number of What If? tokens equal to half the result. // POWER: Remove a What If? token. If you do, replace an adjacent friendly character with a character of equal or less points from your Sideline on its starting line. The replacement character must share a name with the replaced character.
Figure Errata
Changed "Ponder the Question...What If?"
Trade The Watcher Want The Watcher

May 27, 2022
Cliffjumper
Pulled in a sealed with a bit of success. The fact that you can switcheroo with him mid game could be very tactical but for all the issues already stated, I think the only think that makes him viable with his limitations would be an errata to make the POWER into a FREE action. That way he could phase up from safety and swap a character in a better power set for the situation. Agree with Pokolo though, I was expecting an interfering duff you in the face Uatu after everything we've gotten already. This couldve been a 150 point figure with the last four clicks being this split dial attached to the trait.
May 7, 2022
Goop
There are a lot of things wrong with this figure. Reliant on dice roll, needs to be adjacent, limited keywords, easy to kill. There are just far better ways to spend 25pts.

April 12, 2022
Bobcat2022
Not that there's anything wrong with this, but even in pretty casual games, I'm hard-pressed to think of a situation where he'd be anything but flavorful. His trait's a paid, more complicated version of those "From an Alternate Earth" traits from 2017... and those were fun... but I only ever used them maybe twice, and in very specific circumstances. You've got to pay 25 points at force construction, probably break theme, keep the guy from being KO'd, get him next to a friendly, and then take a power action. To swap for a character of the same name, of equal or fewer points, that comes in on the same click. When I think of "characters with multiple versions at similar point costs who do meaningfully different things," there's usually already a Shifting Focus for that. Or someone with a "Form The New Fantastic Four"-type swap-squad trait for their main keyword (which is free, and usually on a figure that also does something else). Plus, the vast majority of the "What If?" characters in this set have very specifically different names from their main-universe counterparts (this watcher can't swap "Heist Nebula" with "Nebula," or "Thor" with "Party Thor," etc). So... what's the use case for this guy? Not saying there isn't one, but I don't see it.
